system_name: Strict Existing Codebase Documentation Workflow, .md, no other formats like pdf or epub
description: Generate a strict, navigable documentation set for an existing Host / Module / Plugin codebase (e.g., RootServer.zip). The workflow first extracts formatting rules from an example docset, then inventories the real source tree, asks only blocking questions, locks a deterministic file plan (fixed numbering), generates the full docset, and runs link/coverage/security validations before bundling.

review_mode.description: Interactive pauses at gates (recommended). Batch runs all phases then emits a review pack with decision points logged.

validation_strictness.description: Strict blocks on required checks; lenient continues but logs all gaps and remediation steps.

patch_behavior.scope: only files impacted by the user's new inputs or corrected assumptions

incremental_update_workflow.trigger: user provides new source or corrections
steps: Map impacts to affected pages via 03-coverage-map.json
Run validators on changed pages + their dependents

version_tracking.purpose: Track documentation evolution and enable rollback

default_assumptions_if_unanswered.note: Changed from disallowed to allowed_with_audit for modern docs needs

default_assumptions_if_unanswered.used_when: UI conventions differ from expected (00-09 layers, prefix system)

only_if: answer is incomplete for strict blockers
multiple paths/targets exist and cannot be disambiguated by discovery
reask_behavior.escalation: If still ambiguous after 2 rounds, document the ambiguity in 05-final-issues.md with investigation plan

severity_levels.high: secrets in example files without .example suffix

restricted_pages.most_pages: external links allowed but must be audited
restricted_pages.{doc_slug}-25-arch-resources.md: primary location for external references with categorization

accessibility.link_text: must be descriptive (no 'click here' or bare URLs)
accessibility.heading_hierarchy: must not skip levels (no H1 → H3)
accessibility.alt_text_for_diagrams: include textual description in prose before diagram

layer_folders.discovery_mode: scan and compare to expected, document actual findings

component_prefixes.discovery_mode: regex scan for patterns, document actual findings

ui_hierarchy_source.discovery_mode: check existence, document alternative if found

if_differs: Do not force-fit actual structure into expected template
Update relevant UI pages (29, 30) with discovered reality
if_absent: Mark UI layer pages as 'Not present in this codebase'
Include brief explanation of what was searched for
No placeholder content or speculation about future implementation

validation.consistency_check: Ensure UI pages (27-38) accurately reflect discovered conventions, not expected ones
validation.cross_reference: Link between 01-source-inventory.md findings and UI documentation

inputs_required.name: project_type
inputs_required.description: Primary project type; if mixed, user must specify which to emphasize

inputs_optional.name: answers_bundle
inputs_optional.description: Large user prompt with answers + context. Used to reduce questions.

inputs_optional.name: external_links_config
inputs_optional.description: Configure external link handling; mode can be 'disallowed', 'allowed_with_audit', or 'unrestricted'

inputs_optional.name: existing_docs_path
inputs_optional.description: Path to existing documentation for health check or incremental update

fixed_numbering.rule: 00..43 fixed ascending; no duplicates; do not renumber within a run.

not_applicable_policy.required_phrase_pattern: Not present in this codebase (as discovered in inventory).
minimum_content: Explain why it's absent (not found vs. not applicable vs. planned)
If planned, reference evidence (roadmap, comments, issue tracker)

consolidation_strategy.rationale: Fixed numbering provides navigational stability; keep all pages even if N/A
consolidation_strategy.alternative: Rich N/A pages with context are more valuable than consolidation

page_lifecycle.generation: all 44 pages (00-43) generated in first run
page_lifecycle.deprecation: pages never removed; mark as deprecated if permanently N/A in future versions
page_lifecycle.evolution: if new page types needed, propose in 05-final-issues.md for next schema version

health_check_mode.purpose: Validate existing documentation integrity without regeneration
checks: Coverage map still valid (source hasn't significantly changed)
Bottom nav present on all pages

synonym_handling.validation_mode: synonyms are allowed; validate primary term is used in key places
synonym_handling.conflict_resolution: if two terms are synonyms, mark one as primary and cross-reference

coverage_formula.formula: coverage_score = sum(component_score * weight for all components)

must_emphasize: integration failure policies at host level

evidence_policy.rule: Claims about structure must cite discovered evidence
evidence_policy.if_unknown: State unknown explicitly + add investigation steps to 05-final-issues.md

must_include: Recommended reading order for different audiences

{doc_slug}-26-ui-index.md.flexibility_note: Adjust section descriptions based on discovered UI conventions

must_include: Discovered numbered layers (00..09) or explicit absence
Actual folder structure, not expected template
Host should not depend on plugins (if host exists)
Where lifecycle decisions live (files/folders) or explicit unknown with investigation plan
Timeout/retry/backoff/circuit breaker notes or explicit unknown with investigation plan
At least 2 concrete examples from discovered source
Duplicate JSON detection hook (ties to appendix 42)
Links to appendix 42 when duplication exists
Where rules are enforced (files/folders) or explicit unknown with investigation plan

{doc_slug}-22-arch-performance-and-obser.strict_mode_rule: Must exist even if targets are unknown; include investigation plan.
must_include: Performance targets (or statement that none are defined)
Known or potential hotspots from code review
Actionable next steps for establishing observability

{doc_slug}-23-arch-testing-and-qa.md.strict_mode_rule: Must exist; if no tests, say so explicitly + remediation plan.
must_include: Recommended testing approach if none exists

{doc_slug}-24-arch-deployment-and-config.strict_mode_rule: Must exist; include local dev steps if found.

{doc_slug}-25-arch-resources.md.external_links_rule: External links allowed with audit trail

must_include: Actual folder structure, not assumed template
Discovered layer folder set (may differ from 00..09 template)
If naming/numbering differs, document actual system
Explicit comparison to expected template if deviations exist
Discovered prefixes (may differ from D_, F_, P_, etc. template)
If prefix system differs, document actual system
Pattern extraction from actual component names
At least 10 mapping entries if the project is non-trivial

{doc_slug}-42-appendix-duplicate-json-cl.if_applicable: Include concrete file pairs, impact analysis, and phased cleanup plan

required_mermaid: sequence diagram for a primary flow
{doc_slug}-43-diagrams.md.accessibility: Include textual description before each diagram

rules: Every generated page is linked from at least one index
Bottom navigation exists on every page
Terms used are defined in 02-terminology-index.json or explicitly marked 'new term' with definition
Primary terms used in key locations (indices, architecture pages)

scoring.formula_transparency: See 03-coverage-map.json for detailed formula and component breakdown

rules: Key discovered areas mapped to pages
Unmapped items listed with a remediation plan
Coverage score calculated using transparent formula
If suspected secrets exist, report locations and risks in appendix 40
No false positives for obviously safe patterns
Relative links for internal, audited external links

phase_5_6_7.constraint: terminology index must be available to all

agents.responsibility: Analyze example_docs_source and extract concrete style constraints (nav patterns, section rhythm, index formatting). Output a template profile used by all later generators.
Validate required inputs and ask only blocking questions. Parse answers_bundle if provided and extract resolved values.

blocking.question: Confirm these are correct: project_source, save_output_to, example_docs_source. If not, provide corrected paths.
Any folders that must be excluded (generated artifacts, node_modules, bin/obj) or included (Docs/, Shared/_Sites)? Provide include/exclude rules.
Confirm project_type is correct (host/module/plugin). If the source contains multiple, pick primary.
If multiple entry points/projects exist, which is primary for documentation focus?

non_blocking.question: Primary audience? (new contributor / reviewer / internal maintainers / external users).
External link preference? (disallowed / allowed_with_audit / unrestricted). Default is allowed_with_audit.

agents.responsibility: Scan project_source and produce a factual inventory of structure, conventions, entry points, DI, integrations, configs, and risks. Use discoverable approach for UI conventions.

sub_agents.name: structure_scanner
sub_agents.purpose: Map folder/file structure, identify projects, namespaces

sub_agents.name: convention_discoverer
sub_agents.purpose: Discover actual UI conventions (layers, prefixes) without forcing template assumptions

strict_blockers: inventory missing entrypoints and key folders

agents.responsibility: Write 01-planned-files.json as the canonical, ordered file list with roles and applicability rules. Lock page contracts for this run (no renumbering).

checks: All 00..43 files are listed exactly once
Indices point only to planned files

agents.responsibility: Generate {doc_slug}.md and the four index files. Ensure they contain correct links and navigation consistent with template profile. Include coverage summary.

checks: Index pages link to all pages in their layer
Root page includes coverage summary placeholder

agents.responsibility: Generate base pages and the terminology index from real discovered facts.

checks: Terminology index created with proper structure
Bottom nav present on all pages

agents.responsibility: Generate architecture pages, with explicit evidence pointers to discovered structure, and include performance/testing/deploy sections even if minimal.

checks: Performance/testing/deployment pages contain required sections with actionable content
External links obey policy and are audited

agents.responsibility: Generate UI layer pages based on discovered UI hierarchy and conventions (not template assumptions). If UI not present, produce explicit not-applicable pages (no placeholders).

checks: If UI absent, pages explicitly state absence with discovered evidence
Prefix/layer numbering documented based on actual discovery, not template
Deviations from expected template explicitly noted
No forced fitting of actual structure into expected template

agents.responsibility: Generate risks/vulnerabilities, source-to-docs mapping, and duplicate JSON cleanup appendix (or explicit not-applicable).

checks: Source-to-docs mapping contains actionable links (>=10 entries for non-trivial projects)
Duplicate JSON appendix includes phased plan (or explicit not-applicable)
Risk assessment includes severity levels and prioritization

agents.responsibility: Generate diagrams page (43), build coverage-map + link-map, run validators in parallel, output final reports, and zip the documentation bundle.

strict_pass_conditions: External links policy respected and audited
UI conventions documented as discovered, not as assumed
lenient_pass_conditions: All index pages have no broken links
All missing or weak coverage areas logged in 05-final-issues.md with remediation plans

steps: Load 01-planned-files.json and verify all files exist
Scan for secrets that may have been accidentally added

recommendations.health_score >= 0.95: Documentation is healthy. No action needed.
recommendations.0.85 <= health_score < 0.95: Minor issues found. Review health-check-report.md and address items.
recommendations.health_score < 0.85: Significant issues found. Consider incremental update or partial regeneration.

usage_prompt_companion.title: RootServer Host Documentation — Workflow Prompt (companion)
usage_prompt_companion.behavior: User provides inputs + optionally an answers_bundle. The system asks only blocking questions, then generates the full docset.
fields: existing_docs_path (optional, for health check or incremental update)

commands.incremental_update: Update documentation based on source changes
